entry.title: Moody’s Drops Coinbase Outlook From Stable to Negative Over Medium Term
entry.summary: Moody’s affirmed its previous Coinbase credit rating but changed its price outlook to negative for the next 12 to 18 months.

entry.title: SEC Chair Gensler Says Crypto Is Rife With ‘Hucksters, Fraudsters, Scam Artists’
entry.summary: Gary Gensler is stepping up his language amid a wider crackdown on the crypto industry which intensified last week with a pair of fresh lawsuits.

entry.title: Binance US Shifts to ‘Crypto-Only’ Operations Amid Intensified SEC Scrutiny
entry.summary: Binance.US is transitioning to a "crypto-only" platform, suspending USD operations, including deposits and withdrawals.

entry.title: Marc Andreessen Warns Against 'Government-Protected Cartel' of Major AI Firms
entry.summary: Noted venture capitalist Marc Andreessen says the market should decide which AI companies succeed or fail—not government restrictions.

entry.title: HyperPlay Raises $12 Million to Accelerate Web3 Game Launcher
entry.summary: The round was co-led by Griffin Gaming Partners and Bitkraft Ventures, and will fuel HyperPlay’s growth and expansion.

entry.title: If You Don’t Like It, Leave: CZ's Message to Employees After SEC Leaks Chat Logs
entry.summary: According to a translated copy of an internal memo, Binance's CEO said the leaked chat logs "did a lot of damage."

entry.title: Elizabeth Warren Wants Another DOJ Investigation Into Binance, Binance US
entry.summary: Her letter makes no mention of the DOJ investigation that's reportedly been ongoing since 2018.

entry.title: Myst Creator’s New Game Was Built With AI—Now Gamers Are Mad
entry.summary: Cyan Worlds is seeing pushback from players after its new adventure game Firmament was developed using AI assistance.

entry.title: Circle CEO Says 'Regulate Us' as Company Hires an Ex-Regulator
entry.summary: Meanwhile: On-chain data shows that 15,000 wallets completely sold their USDC within a five-hour window on Thursday, according to Glassnode.

entry.title: Researchers Can Identify AI-Generated Academic Writing with '99% Accuracy'
entry.summary: ChatGPT’s penchant for using the words "others" and "researchers" over words like "however," "but," and "although" proved to be a dead giveaway

entry.title: Cathie Wood Slams the SEC, Claims Coinbase Will Come Out a Winner
entry.summary: ARK Invest’s CEO said that the SEC’s prompt action against Coinbase following the Binance lawsuit was “unfortunate.”

entry.title: A New Type of 'Social Token': PairedWorld Aims to Incentivize Real-World Connection
entry.summary: Developed with health experts, PairedWorld is designed to add value to existing NFT communities and encourage physical world interactions.

entry.title: What Are the Dangers of AI?
entry.summary: Some experts believe the Singularity could occur within the next decade, although the implications for this event are broadly unknown and speculative.

entry.title: Mike Novogratz: Galaxy Digital 'Looking at How Fast We Can Move People Offshore'
entry.summary: A "legislative stalemate" in the U.S. has the crypto investment firm accelerating its plans to move offshore.

entry.title: Is Gala Safe? Gala Games Head of Blockchain on GALA, Crypto, and SEC Regulatory Turmoil
entry.summary: Gala Games President of Blockchain shares his thoughts on the GALA token upgrade and the latest SEC turmoil with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Artists Adopting NFTs Has Been ‘Really Market Dependent’, Says NFT Club Berlin’s Rebekka Revel
entry.summary: Getting non-crypto artists to make the leap into Web3 comes in ebbs and flows according to the market’s bear and bull waves, says co-founder of NFT Club Berlin and Superteam Germany Rebekka Revel. But she’s hoping to change that by changing the narrative around digital collectibles, regardless of the market, one word at a time.

entry.title: Big Brands Exploring Web3 to ‘Scale Up Their Superfan Base’: SuperDuper Co-founder
entry.summary: Co-founder and co-CEO of Web3 media brand SuperDuper Dom Smith says big brands are eager to enter the space—they just don’t know how. Still, they all maintain a thesis of turning their communities into “super fans” that generate value for users as well as a firm’s bottom line.

entry.title: eToro: 'We Remain a Supporter of Crypto' Amid Enforcement Blitz
entry.summary: The agency’s lawsuit against Binance and Coinbase has drawn the attention of other firms that offer stocks and crypto.

entry.title: Lens Protocol Raises $15 Million to Expand Decentralized Social Media
entry.summary: Built by the creators of Aave, Lens allows users to own their online presence as part of the decentralized protocol.

entry.title: UK Authors' Union Issues Guidance to 'Protect' Writers’ Work From AI
entry.summary: The Society of Authors warned writers to be careful as “money today could simply speed up the absence of any work at all in the future.”

entry.title: Binance Moved Billions Through US Bank Accounts Controlled by CZ, Says SEC
entry.summary: The filing claims Binance entities commingled funds and funneled them to a Paxos affiliate through Merit Peak, which was controlled by Changpeng Zhao.

entry.title: You Can Earn Bitcoin for Using This Twitter Alternative
entry.summary: "Say goodbye to meaningless likes and embrace the opportunity to earn money for your online contributions," said Zebedee co-founder Andre Neves.

entry.title: New UK Crypto Investors Face ‘Cooling-Off Period’ Under FCA Rules
entry.summary: The new advertising rules will force first-time investors to wait 24 hours between requesting to purchase crypto and being able to buy.

entry.title: Apple Vision Pro vs. Meta Quest Pro: What's the Difference?
entry.summary: It’s the battle of Pro headsets from tech giants. How does Apple’s first effort compare to the market leader’s top-end device?

entry.title: SEC Chair Gensler Offered to Serve as Binance Advisor in 2019, Lawyers Claim
entry.summary: Documents filed as part of the ongoing court case between the SEC and Binance allege that Gary Gensler and Changpeng Zhao have history.

entry.title: How 1 Simple Question Kickstarted Performance Artist Foodmasku's Plunge Into NFTs
entry.summary: As his food mask creations went viral on the Internet during the COVID lockdowns, reposted on TikTok and Instagram without his consent, he soon asked: "How do I protect my digital files?" Performance artist Foodmasku describes at this year's NFC Lisbon how that simple question spiraled into a minting collection after collection of his edible works.

entry.title: Arianee CEO Pegs Wine and Spirits as Next 'Exciting' Industry to Make Web3 Leap
entry.summary: CEO and co-founder of Arianee Pierre Nicolas Hurstel unpacks the wide spectrum of digital collectibles from 10,000 PFP collections to access passes for exclusive events. And with an unannounced big brand soon joining, Hurstel revealed at NFC Lisbon which kind of NFTs big brands are moving towards.

entry.title: Cathie Wood's ARK Bought $22M Worth of Coinbase Shares After the Price Tanked
entry.summary: ARK Invest is the second largest COIN shareholder behind Vanguard Group.

entry.title: What’s the Difference Between the Binance and Coinbase SEC Lawsuits?
entry.summary: The SEC has gone after the two major crypto brands this week—but with very different allegations.

entry.title: Did Apple's Headset Reveal Revive the Web3 Metaverse—Or Kill It?
entry.summary: Apple's Vision Pro could inject much-needed life into the sagging metaverse industry, but can the tech giant complement Web3's open ethos?

entry.title: Radio Host Sues OpenAI for Libel After ChatGPT Accuses Him of Crime
entry.summary: The Georgia-based broadcaster claims defamation after ChatGPT allegedly said he embezzled funds.

entry.title: ‘Big Ass No’: Hong Kong Trading Not a Sign China Is Warming Up to Crypto
entry.summary: Hong Kong is trying to be a crypto hub again. This doesn’t mean China is following suit.

entry.title: The SEC Has Not Labeled Any Proof-of-Work Asset as a Security—Why Is That?
entry.summary: The agency has focused on Proof-of-Stake coins, leaving Bitcoin and other Proof-of-Work blockchains unfazed by the current regulatory push.

entry.title: GameStop Fires CEO Who Oversaw Retailer's NFT Push
entry.summary: Months after signaling a retreat from crypto efforts, GameStop axes CEO Matt Furlong and promotes Ryan Cohen to executive chairman.

entry.title: Binance.US Pulls Several Trading Pairs in Wake of SEC Lawsuit
entry.summary: The cryptocurrency exchange will drop over 40 trading pairs from their platform, the majority against USDT.

entry.title: Why 'Words With Friends' Creator Paul Bettner is 'Allergic' to Pay-to-Win NFTs
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on what to do when NFTs become in-game characters and assets.

entry.title: Puma Plots NFT Sneaker Drop With NBA's LaMelo Ball, Gutter Cat Gang
entry.summary: Sportswear brand Puma has partnered with NBA star LeMelo Ball to drop a limited edition pair of sneakers featuring Gutter Cat Gang branding.

entry.title: DeFi Trading Surges as Centralized Exchanges Feel Regulators' Wrath
entry.summary: After back-to-back SEC enforcement actions against centralized exchanges, Uniswap has seen a 41% increase in trading volume.

entry.title: Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan: 18 Months is 'Several Decades' in Crypto
entry.summary: Fractal and Twitch co-founder Justin Kan gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin an update on all things Fractal and his perspective on blockchain technology in gaming.

entry.title: SAG Head: AI Is a ‘Game Changer’ With Both Threats and Opportunities
entry.summary: SAG-AFTRA members seek “informed consent and fair compensation” if AI is used to recreate an actor’s likeness.

entry.title: Will MiCA Jumpstart Crypto in EU? It's ‘Too Early To Tell’, Says Circle
entry.summary: "It does give us that legal certainty that we needed, but it’s just really a part of the story," Kraken's EU policy head said.

entry.title: Sandbox COO: 'We Do Not Agree' With SEC Labeling SAND Token a Security
entry.summary: SAND was called out this week as the U.S. regulator targets Binance and Coinbase, but The Sandbox says it’s business as usual for now.

entry.title: Central Banks Should Not Dominate CBDCs, Says an Ex-Central Banker
entry.summary: Jón Helgi Egilsson, a former chairman of the Icelandic central bank, urged his former counterparts to "embrace competition" on CBDCs.

entry.title: Do Kwon Claims to Have Backed Political Party in Montenegro: Report
entry.summary: Terra co-founder Do Kwon allegedly had financial relations with the leader of a political party in Montenegro.

entry.title: Ex-Oasis Rocker Noel Gallagher Turns to NFTs to Top Foo Fighters in UK Chart Race
entry.summary: It’s a fervent fight to top the album charts, and Noel Gallagher’s High Flying Birds is launching an NFT edition to try and eke out a win.

entry.title: IKEA Research Studio Uses AI to Create a Folding Sofa that Fits in an Envelope
entry.summary: We’re heading towards a future where getting sofas up and down flights of stairs is no longer a Sisyphean chore.

entry.title: US Court Gives SEC One Week to Respond to Coinbase’s Rulemaking Petition
entry.summary: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit has given the SEC seven days to clarify its position on a rulemaking petition from Coinbase.

entry.title: Playing for Money in Web3 Games Not 'Durable,' Says Fractal's Justin Kan
entry.summary: Twitch and Fractal co-founder Justin Kan and Fractal co-founder Dan Borstelmann share their perspectives on Web3 gaming's changing landscape with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: From Cyber Cafe to Web3: How Everquest Dev Jeffrey Butler Got Into Game Development
entry.summary: Everquest developer turned Avalon Chief Product Officer Jeffrey Butler tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he got into game development.

entry.title: The Machines Arena Game Preview: Is This the Next Overwatch?
entry.summary: Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shares an inside look at The Machines Arena, an upcoming top-down 4v4 shooter from Directive Games that will offer NFTs minted on Ethereum sidechain network Ronin.

entry.title: You 'Have' to Be on Mobile: InfiniGods Cofounders on Gaming
entry.summary: InfiniGods developers Damon Gura and Owen O’Donoghue share their stance on why mobile gaming is essential to Web3 adoption and general success in the video games industry.

entry.title: Crypto Chaos of 2022 'Didn't Damage Technology Underlying the Industry': X Ventures Co-Founder Matthias Reiser
entry.summary: Ahead of this month's Proof of Talk event in Paris on June 14 and June 15, X Ventures co-founder and the event's co-organizer Dr. Matthias Reiser said nothing's changed for those with a "long-term view" of the industry. Still, events like the collapse of Terra and FTX in 20222 have certainly damaged investors' trust in crypto.

entry.title: Tron's Justin Sun Thinks Hong Kong Will Be a Big Fiat Onramp for Crypto
entry.summary: Justin Sun, Tron founder and advisor to crypto exchange Huobi, talks to Decrypt's Liam Kelly and Stacy Elliott about the impact of Hong Kong allowing residents to trade crypto, complications of restricting access based on location, and how AI will change the industry.

entry.title: NVIDIA's AI Push Could Change Gaming Forever
entry.summary: Computer tech firm NVIDIA profited off the crypto mining industry. Now, it's looking to artificial intelligence—and its stock price is soaring.

entry.title: Why InfiniGods Laughs at 'AAA' Web3 Games
entry.summary: The InfiniGods founders share their approach to game development and offer a critique of games that call themselves "AAA."

entry.title: Make it Fast, Make it Friendly: Jerome de Tychey Unpacks Key Themes at This Year's EthCC
entry.summary: After six years running, EthCC is back, this time in Paris from July 17 to July 20. Decrypt sat down with the brains behind one of Ethereum’s longest-running events Jerome de Tychey to get an inside look into what’s on the agenda this year, several unannounced guests, and the rollout of at least one “secret” DeFi project.

entry.title: Unioverse Game Preview: Hands-on With the Cinematic Proving Grounds
entry.summary: The Unioverse is a multimedia sci-fi franchise with plans to facilitate user-generated content. Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin checked out the Unioverse as Reyu, an alien character, and navigated the Proving Grounds with him. In the Proving Grounds, you'll fight an array of different drone-like flying robots (some have tentacles!!) as you navigate the puzzle-like dystopian environment. Alien meets Portal, anyone?

entry.title: EverQuest Producer Jeffrey Butler on How Ready Player One Led Him to Web3 Project Avalon
entry.summary: Jeffrey Butler started his game development career producing EverQuest. Now, he's Avalon's Chief Product Officer. Butler told Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he wants to create a customizable world where users can create their own worlds and in-game content.

entry.title: Esports Orgs Should Become More Like Tech Companies: Community Gaming CEO
entry.summary: Community Gaming CEO and 3XP conference organizer Chris Gonsalves believes crypto and tech could rejuvenate and reinvent the esports industry. In an interview, he tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin why he thinks esports organizations should shake up their approach.

entry.title: SNEAK PEEK: Inside Mirandus From Gala Games
entry.summary: GG's Kate Irwin takes us on a journey inside Mirandus, the upcoming MMORPG from Gala Games.
